title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: Whenever they went to Glenrothes he saw the yearning in Sarah's eyes, her desire for a grandchild.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: He was staying the weekend in Glenrothes, and they went for a big walk, through the old town of  Leslie, up the Falkland road and on to the Lomond Hills.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: Then came the request, at tea one evening, to stay away overnight, for a dance at a youth club in Glenrothes.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: If  Uncle Jack had still been around he'd have gone over to Wharryburn to see him, but Uncle Jack was long away and so were Sarah and Barbara, off   to a new life in Glenrothes, not that he'd have bothered with them.

title: And the Land Lay Still
author: Robertson, James
snippet: 'Defi nitely,' Liz said, as if  the one thing she was determined on was to see Sarah and Barbara on to the bus to Glenrothes.

title: And the Land Lay Still

snippet: The future of  Glenrothes would be built on this vast black treasure vault, and the whole economy of  Fife would be powered by it.
